post_message: Ever wonder why you so rarely hear "Happy Birthday to You" on TV or the big screen? Turns out that, while it may be one of the most recognized songs in the English language, its copyright is also owned by a music publisher. So, if you're going to sing those famous strains on screen, you'd better be prepared to fork over some cash.
